meanings.sent1: I read the gazette every morning for the latest news.
meanings.sent2: The local gazette reported on the community events.
meanings.sent3: The gazette had a funny comic strip that made me laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a gazette of memories, each page filled with moments.
meanings.sent5: The gazette was filled with colorful pictures that captured my attention.

meanings.definition: To announce or publish in a gazette.
meanings.sent1: The mayor will gazette the new law in tomorrow's edition.
meanings.sent2: They decided to gazette the upcoming event in the city paper.
meanings.sent3: I will gazette the surprise party in the school newsletter.
meanings.sent4: His words gazetted across the town, spreading the important message.
meanings.sent5: The announcement was gazetted on the front page for everyone to see.
